name: SEER Primary Tumor
title: SEER Primary Tumor
notes: **Note:**  Uveal melanomas arise most commonly in the choroid, less frequently in the ciliary body, and least often in the iris.  Melanomas of the iris tend to be small, and those arising from or extending to the ciliary body typically are large.

In Situ

In situ, intraepithelial, noninvasive

Localized only

     Tumor confined to iris
     Tumor  invades into:
           Anterior chamber angle
           Choroid
           Ciliary body
           Other parts of eye

    Localized, NOS

Limited to iris, NOS

Limited to iris WITH or WITHOUT  melanomalytic (secondary) glaucoma

Tumor confluent with or extending into the ciliary body and/or choroid 
WITH scleral extension,
WITH or WITHOUT melanomalytic (secondary) glaucoma

Stated as T1 (T1a, T1b, T1c, T1 [NOS]), T2a, T2NOS, T3a, or T3 [NOS]

Stated as T2b, T2c, T4 (T4a, T4b, T4 [NOS]
